citeinfo.title: COAL_AVAILABILITY_DANVILLE_IN_DEPTH: Depth to the Danville Coal Member (Dugger Formation, Pennsylvanian System), Derived from Coal Availability Investigations (Indiana Geological Survey, Polygon Shapefile)
The Availability of the Danville Coal Member for Mining in Indiana, Indiana Geological Survey Open-file Study 2000-01

descript.abstract: COAL_AVAILABILITY_DANVILLE_IN_DEPTH is a polygon shapefile giving depth (in feet) to the top of the Danville Coal Member in Indiana. COAL_AVAILABILITY_DANVILLE_IN_DEPTH was extracted from COAL_AVAILABILITY_DANVILLE_IN. COAL_AVAILABILITY_DANVILLE_IN identifies those resources of the Danville Coal Member in Indiana which have favorable geologic and land use characteristics for surface and underground mining, as well as those which have unfavorable geologic and land use characteristics for surface and underground mining. In addition, COAL_AVAILABILITY_DANVILLE_IN describes the geology of the Danville Coal, including coal thickness, coal depth, and stripping ratio.
descript.purpose: COAL_AVAILABILITY_DANVILLE_IN_DEPTH is a polygon shapefile giving depth (in feet) to the top of the Danville Coal Member in Indiana. COAL_AVAILABILITY_DANVILLE_IN_DEPTH was extracted from COAL_AVAILABILITY_DANVILLE_IN. COAL_AVAILABILITY_DANVILLE_IN is a modified version of an ESRI ArcInfo polygon coverage that was created as a necessary component of a USGS-sponsored Coal Availability study to assess the resources of the Danville Coal in Indiana, and to identify those resources that have the most favorable geologic and land use characteristics for mining. The results of this study include county-based tabular reports of the tonnage of original Danville Coal resources in place, remaining resources after mining, resources unlikely to be mined due to geologic and land use factors, and Danville Coal resources that are deemed "available" (i.e., favorable) for mining according to the criteria of this study.

idinfo.native: ESRI ArcView version 3.2 polygon shapefile, Microsoft Windows NT version 4.0

attracc.attraccr: The polygon attribute values were checked to ensure that the values were within the range that should be expected based upon the values of the input data that were used to create the polygon coverage.

dataqual.logic: ESRI ArcInfo polygon topology is present.
dataqual.complete: The geographic extent of this coverage encompasses the extent of Danville Coal Member in Indiana.

horizpa.horizpar: The minimum horizontal positional accuracy of this coverage is determined by that of the least horizontally accurate polygon coverage that was used to make this coverage. The minimum horizontal accuracy value is therefore estimated to be 200 meters.

srctime.srccurr: Date of most recent update to the dataset.

srcinfo.srccontr: This source provided an ESRI ArcView polygon shapefile that characterizes the geology of the Danville Coal, including depth.

procstep.procdesc: All fields except for the field named "Depth" were deleted from COAL_AVAILABILITY_DANVILLE_IN and the new shapefile was saved under the name "COAL_AVAILABILITY_DANVILLE_IN_DEPTH."

COAL_AVAILABILITY_DANVILLE_IN_DEPTH.SHP was temporarily converted to an ESRI ArcGIS 8.3 coverage format, and ESRI ArcGIS 8.3 ArcToolbox was used to dissolve polygons using the field named "DEPTH." This converted 66,695 polygons found before dissolve, down to 969 polygons. The coverage was then converted to the shapefile COAL_AVAILABILITY_DANVILLE_IN_DEPTH.SHP using ArcToolbox.

This metadata was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (United States Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."

attr.attrdef: Depth to the top of the Danville Coal, expressed in ranges of depth in feet.

distinfo.distliab:
CREDIT
It is requested that the Indiana Geological Survey be cited in any products generated from this data. The following source citation should be included: [COAL_AVAILABILITY_DANVILLE_IN_DEPTH: Depth to the Danville Coal Member (Dugger Formation, Pennsylvanian System), Derived from Coal Availability Investigations (Indiana Geological Survey, Polygon Shapefile)]
WARRANTY
Indiana University, Indiana Geological Survey warrants that the media on which this product is stored will be free from defect in materials and workmanship for ninety (90) days from the date of acquisition. If such a defect is found, return the media to Publication Sales, Indiana Geological Survey, 611 North Walnut Grove, Bloomington, Indiana 47405-2208, and it will be replaced free of charge.
LIMITATION OF WARRANTIES AND LIABILITY
Except for the expressed warranty above, the product is provided "AS IS", without any other warranties or conditions, expressed or implied, including, but not limited to, warranties for product quality, or suitability to a particular purpose or use. The risk or liability resulting from the use of this product is assumed by the user. Indiana University, Indiana Geological Survey shares no liability with product users indirect, incidental, special, or consequential damages whatsoever, including, but not limited to, loss of revenue or profit, lost or damaged data or other commercial or economic loss. Indiana University, Indiana Geological Survey is not responsible for claims by a third party. The maximum aggregate liability to the original purchaser shall not exceed the amount paid by you for the product.

metainfo.metuc: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It should not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.
